snippet.title: 'Bioshock Infinite' postponed until 2013
snippet.description:
* What was arguably the most anticipated video game of 2012 just became one of the most anticipated games for 2013.
http://www.cnn.com/2012/05/09/tech/gaming-gadgets/bioshock-infinite/index.html

snippet.title: Atletico left frustrated as Chelsea battle to scoreless draw in Vicente Calderon
snippet.description:
* Jose Mourinho's Chelsea exerted a tactical stranglehold on hosts Atletico Madrid to earn a goalless draw in the first leg of their Champions League semifinal Tuesday.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/22/sport/football/chelsea-atletico-madrid-football/index.html

snippet.title: The delicate and utterly mouth-watering art of world's master Easter egg makers
snippet.description:
* French fashion designers don't hold a monopoly on haute.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/18/world/europe/the-delicate-art-of-worlds-master-easter-egg/index.html

snippet.title: A fatal wait: Veterans languish and die on a VA hospital's secret list
snippet.description:
* At least 40 U.S. veterans died waiting for appointments at the Phoenix Veterans Affairs Health Care system, many of whom were placed on a secret waiting list.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/23/health/veterans-dying-health-care-delays/index.html

snippet.title: Does the Bible predict the 'blood moon'?
snippet.description:
* Opinion by Kenneth L. Waters Sr., special to CNN (CNN) - Are the End Times finally at hand? To some Christians, the answer will be as clear as the moon in the sky. Monday night will host a rare celestial event: a “blood moon,” which occurs when the...
http://religion.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/14/whats-up-with-the-blood-moons-prophecies/

snippet.title: Was Michigan ruling a case of colorblindness or willful blindness?
snippet.description:
* In the aftermath of the decision in Schuette v. Coalition to Defend Affirmative Action, there is one thing (and perhaps only one thing) that most everyone agrees upon: It is a game changer.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/24/opinion/turley-michigan-affirmative-action-case/index.html

snippet.title: Paulina Gretzky's controversial Golf Digest cover
snippet.description:
* Model Paulina Gretzky isn't a pro golfer but she's made it onto the cover of the latest issue of Golf Digest.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/04/showbiz/celebrity-news-gossip/paulina-gretzky-golf-digest/index.html

snippet.title: Using tablets to reach kids with autism
snippet.description:
* Two 5-year-old boys, one with autism, were having some friendly playtime when they had a communication breakdown. One boy didn't respond to the other and walked away. The ignored kid got frustrated and pushed over a small staircase, causing the first boy to fall.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/09/tech/innovation/autism-tablet-apps/index.html

snippet.title: Official: Health Secretary Kathleen Sebelius resigning
snippet.description:
* Kathleen Sebelius -- who weathered heavy criticism over the flaw-filled launch of the Obamacare website, then saw the program through as it topped a major milestone -- is resigning as secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services, a White House official said Thursday.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/10/politics/kathleen-sebelius-resigning/index.html
